resources.string: WordSmash cannot find a network connection. To work properly, WordSmash has to talk to the mother ship.
The network connection took too long to return. To work properly, WordSmash has to talk to the mother ship.
Please enter your email to connect to play. Never fear, it will not be shared.
Please enter your nickname. This will be the name to other players see.
Your nickname can only contain letters, numbers, spaces, dots, and hyphens.
Please enter a valid email to connect to play. We\'ll never share it, we just may send game-related emails out every now and then. Did we mention we\'ll never share it?
Please enter the nickname of the opponent you are trying to find.
Sorry, a maximum of four players can be added to a game.
Sorry, only the logged in user can start a game.
This nickname is already in use by another player.
This email is already in use by another player.
The error could not be determined. Please try again later.
The server could not be found. Please try again later.
The auth token could not be found.
Please enter a password that is at least 6 characters long.
The email associated with your Facebook account has already been registered in WordSmash.
You cannot add yourself as an opponent.
%s has already been added as an opponent.
The game must have either 2, 3, or 4 players.
Unfortunately, something messy happened down in the bowels of the code. Not to worry, we will get it fixed. In the meantime, you might want to restart WordSmash.
Something funky happened when communicating with the mother ship.
enough to get you off and running
To start the game, a letter of the first word must be placed on at least one of the smiley faces.

Then take turns forming valid words by dragging letters from your tray to the board. At least one of your placed letters must connect to (or be placed on top of) letters already placed on the board in previous turns.
During a turn, be sure to place all of your letters in a single line, either vertically or horizontally.
If it\'s your turn, you can also skip the turn or swap letters.
Keep it up until all the letters are used. The player with the highest score wins.

The idea is to score more points than your opponent by forming valid words out of the letters in your tray. Letters must be placed on the board in a single axis, either horizontally or vertically. As you win more games, you\'ll earn new badges.

To start the game, the letters of the first word must placed on at least one of the smiley faces. All words must contain 2 or more letters. The players alternate turns. Each turn after the first must place at least one letter next to a previously placed letter on the board, either to the left or right or above or below, OR overlaying a previously played letter.

Overlays are letters that are played over a letter that was placed on the board in any previous turn. Just remember that a player must overlay a letter with a different letter. In other words, one cannot overlay an \"A\" with another \"A\". The letters must be different.

A player can skip a turn or swap letters. Swapped letters are returned to the hopper, the hopper is reshuffled, and the amount of swapped letters are pulled out of the hopper and given to the player. The player\'s turn is then skipped. Swapping is not allowed after the hopper is empty.
105 letters are shuffled and stored in the hopper until they are dispersed into the player\'s trays. The mix of the first 100 letters is as follows:

The final 5 letters are made up of 3 randomly chosen consonants and 2 randomly chosen vowels (A, E, I, O, or U). The random letters will be unique, meaning that the random consonants chosen might be "P", "R", and "C", but would never be "P", "R", and "R".
Each letter has an assigned value as follows:
The codes on the board represent bonus values that are multiplied times various letter values that are placed during a turn.
the value of the individual letter is multiplied by 2.
the value of the individual letter is multiplied by 3.
the value of the individual letter is multiplied by 4.
the value of the word is multiplied by 2.
the value of the word is multiplied by 3.

If an overlay is placed on a bonus tile the bonus does not count. Only the overlay\'s letter value counts. Other bonus tiles in the same turn count normally, just not overlays. An overlays\'s letter values are are calculated as part of the value of the word if another letter is placed on a 2W or 3W.
If more than one word is formed during a turn, bonus tiles values are only assigned to the word that contained the bonus tiles.

Letter multipliers are calculated before word multipliers when the score is calculated for a turn. If a word lands on more than one word multiplier bonus tile, each bonus multipliers is used to determine the final score.
Another way to earn points is to use all 7 letters in your tray in a single turn. If you use 7 letters in a single turn, you\'ve played a smasher, which is worth 40 bonus points.

Normally, the game ends when a player uses all of the letters in his or her tray after the hopper has been emptied. The first person to finish the letters gets a bonus value added to his or her score. The bonus is equal to the accumulated value of all of the letters left in the opponent\'s tray. For instance, if a player finished out the letters (and the hopper was empty) and the opponent still had a "K", a "U", and a "B" left in the tray, a bonus of 15 points would be awarded to the player in addition to the points that the turn earned. The player with the most points after the bonus is awarded is declared the winner. If both players have the same score, a draw is declared.

If 4 skips in a row happen (2 by one player and 2 by the opponent), the game is automatically stopped and a winner is determined based on the points already earned by the 2 players. No bonus points are awarded in this situation. If both players have the same score, a draw is declared.

If a player concedes the game, the opponent automatically wins, even if the player was leading at the time or the score was tied. If the player was leading (or the score was tied) when the concede button was clicked, the opponent\'s score is adjusted to be 1 point higher than the player\'s score, making the opponent the winner.
If a turn has not been taken for 2 weeks (or so), the player whose turn is pending will automatically "concede".

The original source for the dictionary is Enhanced North American Benchmark Lexicon (ENABLE). We are continually expanding our dictionary. If you determine that we are missing a word, please leave us a word suggestion and we will verify the word and add it to the dictionary as quickly as we can. The definitions lookups are from wordnik image here. Thanks to the wordnik folks for providing such a great service!
a better badge means more wins
Sorry, we couldn\'t find a player with that nickname.
We couldn\'t find the server. Please try again later.
Logging out will remove the player and game data from this device. No worries though. You can always log back in. Hurry back!

WordSmash uses an awesome service called Gravatar to let you have your own personal profile image. 

Gravatar is owned by the folks that own WordPress, so it's a reliable and safe service. All you have to do is sign up at Gravatar.com with the same email address you used to connect with WordSmash, upload your image to Gravatar, and your G or PG-rated Gravatar will become available on WordSmash!

(And not to worry, your email address is never exposed.)
If you have already set up your Gravatar and aren\'t seeing it above (to the right of the WordSmash logo), let WordSmash fetch it again.

You should now be seeing your latest Gravatar above.

 If you just updated your Gravatar and you're not seeing it above, try to refresh it again in WordSmash in a few minutes, since it could take 5 to 10 minutes for avatar changes to take effect at Gravatar.

 If you still don't see your Gravatar after the recommendation above, perhaps it was not updated properly at Gravatar.com, or perhaps your Gravatar is associated with an email other then %s.

please tap on an opponent to add to the game or tap back to cancel.
A game is waiting for you in WordSmash, the new multi-player crossword Android game!
%s is not registered in WordSmash yet so the Facebook app request is the only way for us to send a notification for the new game.
